rev.comment: He was convicted today, not charged
rev.diff:
Line 22: Line 22:
The 1965 song "[[You've Lost That Lovin' Feelin']]", produced and co-written by Spector for the [[The Righteous Brothers]], is listed by [[Broadcast Music Incorporated|BMI]] as the song with the most U.S. air play in the 20th century.<ref>[http://www.bmi.com/news/entry/232893 "BMI Announces Top 100 Songs of the Century"] from BMI website</ref>
The 1965 song "[[You've Lost That Lovin' Feelin']]", produced and co-written by Spector for the [[The Righteous Brothers]], is listed by [[Broadcast Music Incorporated|BMI]] as the song with the most U.S. air play in the 20th century.<ref>[http://www.bmi.com/news/entry/232893 "BMI Announces Top 100 Songs of the Century"] from BMI website</ref>
â
In later years, Spector has become increasingly known for his eccentricity, reclusive temperament and obsessive behavior. The 2003 shooting death of Lana Clarkson in his home led to [[Phil Spector#Murder charges|him being charged with murder in the second degree]]. His first trial ended in a [[mistrial]]. He was charged with second degree murder on April 13, 2009.
+
In later years, Spector has become increasingly known for his eccentricity, reclusive temperament and obsessive behavior. The 2003 shooting death of Lana Clarkson in his home led to [[Phil Spector#Murder charges|him being charged with murder in the second degree]]. His first trial ended in a [[mistrial]]. He was convicted of second degree murder on April 13, 2009.
